org.jtrim.swing.component

Class BasicTransformedImageDisplay<ImageAddress>

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • org.jtrim.swing.component.Graphics2DComponent
            • org.jtrim.swing.component.AsyncRenderingComponent
              • org.jtrim.swing.component.TransformedImageDisplay<ImageAddress>
                • org.jtrim.swing.component.BasicTransformedImageDisplay<ImageAddress>
  • Type Parameters:
    ImageAddress - the type of the address of the image to be displayed. That is, the input of the image query.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable

    public class BasicTransformedImageDisplay<ImageAddress>
extends TransformedImageDisplay<ImageAddress>
    Defines a Swing component which is able to display an image, applying a series of user defined transformations and convenience methods to apply basic image transformations. This component supports every transformation of the BasicTransformationModel.

    Additionally, this component is able to display the image using various interpolation types. The default one is the bilinear interpolation.

    This component defines the offset of the image so that if it is (0.0, 0.0), the center of the image will be in the center of the component.

    About other properties of this component see the description of TransformedImageDisplay.

    Applying additional transformations

    If you need to apply additional transformations before or after the affine transformation applied by this component, you may use the getAffineTransformationPos() reference (e.g.: getAffineTransformationPos().addBefore). Note however, that this component assumes that transformations applied after the affine transformation will not further adjust the coordinate transformation applied to the source image (i.e., they will return the identity transformation in the pointTransformer property of TransformedImage). That is, transformations applied after the affine transformation are only expected to draw some additional overlay on the image, or do some color conversion. There is no such expectation on transformations applied before the affine transformation.

    Thread safety

    The thread-safety property of this component is the same as with any other Swing components. That is, instances of this class can be accessed only from the AWT Event Dispatch Thread. Exceptions from this rule are made only for reading MutableProperty and PropertySource instances. This is true, even for getting those properties (in particular, it is safe to call the transformations() method from any thread).
    See Also:
    TransformedImageDisplay, Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • BasicTransformedImageDisplay

        public BasicTransformedImageDisplay()
        Creates a BasicTransformedImageDisplay with identity transformation applying bilinear transformations (the interpolation type only matters if the transformation is changed to something else than identity).

        The setAsyncRenderer method must be called before displaying the component.

      • BasicTransformedImageDisplay

        public BasicTransformedImageDisplay(AsyncRendererFactory asyncRenderer)
        Creates a BasicTransformedImageDisplay with identity transformation applying bilinear transformations (the interpolation type only matters if the transformation is changed to something else than identity).
        Parameters:
        asyncRenderer - the AsyncRendererFactory to be used to render this component. This argument can be null, in which case, the AsyncRendererFactory must be set later by the setAsyncRenderer method.

        Overrides:

      • addAffineTransformationListener

        public final org.jtrim.event.ListenerRef addAffineTransformationListener(TransformationListener listener)
        Adds a listener whose appropriate method will be called when the affine transformation applied to the source image changes.
        Parameters:
        listener - the listener whose appropriate method will be called when a property changes. This argument cannot be null.
        Returns:
        the reference which can be used to remove the currently added listener. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified listener is null

      • interpolationType

        public final MutableProperty<InterpolationType> interpolationType()
        Returns the property defining what interpolation algorithm is to be used by the applied affine transformation.

        The value of this property can never be null, and is InterpolationType.BILINEAR by default.

        Returns:
        the property defining what interpolation algorithm is to be used by the applied affine transformation. This method may never return null.

      • getAffineTransformationPos

        public final TransformationStepPos getAffineTransformationPos()
        Returns the position of the affine transformation applied to the source image. You can use this position the add addition transformations before or after the affine transformation is applied.

        Note: You may only add transformations after the affine transformation which do not further adjust the coordinate transformation applied to the source image.

        Returns:
        the position of the affine transformation applied to the source image. This method never returns null.

      • transformations

        public final BasicTransformationProperty transformations()
        Returns a container for the properties (MutableProperty) of the applied affine transformations. The returned transformation can be used when generic handling of the properties are needed or the calling code needs to be notified when a particular property changes.

        For example, you can use transformations().rotateInRadians().addChangeListener to listen for changes made to the rotation attribute.

        Note that although you can also change the values of properties via the reference returned by this method, it is recommended to use the setter methods directly provided by BasicTransformedImageDisplay. This is recommended because they offer better performance and are (usually) more convenient.

        Returns:
        a container for the properties (MutableProperty) of the applied affine transformations. This method never returns null.

      • isInZoomToFitMode

        public final boolean isInZoomToFitMode()
        Returns true if the image will be scaled to fit this component. That is, this method returns the same value as the following expression: getZoomToFitOptions() != null.

        If the zoom to fit requirement conflicts with any of the properties of this component, the zoom to fit mode will take precedence.

        Returns:
        true if the image will be scaled to fit the display in which it is displayed, false if it should be displayed according to the other properties of this component

      • getZoomToFitOptions

        public final java.util.Set<ZoomToFitOption> getZoomToFitOptions()
        Returns the set of rules to be used when displaying the image in zoom to fit mode or null if other properties of this component will be used instead.
        Returns:
        the set of rules which will be used when displaying the image in zoom to fit mode or null if other properties of this component will be used instead

      • alwaysClearZoomToFit

        public final MutableProperty<java.lang.Boolean> alwaysClearZoomToFit()
        Returns the property defining if this component will leave the zoom to fit mode when a transformation property of this component is modified even if setting the property does not conflict with the zoom to fit mode (such as rotate). That is, if the value of this property is true, setting any property related to the affine transformation will clear the zoom to fit mode. If this property is false, only properties conflicting with the zoom to fit mode will cause the zoom to fit mode to be disabled.

        The value of this property can never be null, and its default value right after constructing this BasicTransformedImageDisplay is false.

        Returns:
        the property defining if this component will leave the zoom to fit mode when a transformation property of this component is modified even if setting the property does not conflict with the zoom to fit mode. This method never returns null.

      • affinePointTransformer

        public final PropertySource<ImagePointTransformer> affinePointTransformer()
        Returns the property holding the value of the coordinate transformation, transforming coordinates from coordinates of the input image to the result applied affine transformation. That is, if you have no more transformation applied other than the affine transformation (or only ones defining identity coordinate transformation), then the ImagePointTransformer of this property will transform the coordinates of the source image to display coordinates of this component.

        The value of this property depends on the currently set properties, not on the last rendering. For example, calling setRotateInRadians(double) will have an immediate effect on the returned property (assuming that the size of the input image is known).

        The value of this property can be null, if the size of the input image is not yet known. Once it is known (i.e.: the image has been rendered at least once), this property will never revert back to null, even if you change the source image.

        Returns:
        the property holding the value of the coordinate transformation, transforming coordinates from coordinates of the input image to the result applied affine transformation. This method never returns null (but its value can be null).

      • getDisplayPointFromPreAffinePoint

        public final java.awt.geom.Point2D getDisplayPointFromPreAffinePoint(java.awt.geom.Point2D beforeAffinePoint)
        Returns where the pixel of the input image passed to the affine transformation is displayed in this component. The result of (0, 0) means the top-left corner of this component. Note that this method may return a coordinate which lies outside this component and does not need to return integer coordinates.

        This is simply a convenience method which relies on the affinePointTransformer() method except that if the coordinate transformation is not yet available this method will return the same coordinates as specified in the argument.

        Note: This method expects that transformations applied after the affine transformation will not further adjust the coordinate transformation.

        Parameters:
        beforeAffinePoint - the coordinates of the pixel on the input image of the affine transformation to be transformed to display coordinates. This argument cannot be null but the coordinates may lay outside the boundaries of the image.
        Returns:
        the coordinates where the specified pixel of the input image of the affine transformation is displayed. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified coordinate is null

      • getPreAffinePoint

        public final java.awt.geom.Point2D getPreAffinePoint(java.awt.geom.Point2D displayPoint)
        Returns which pixel of the input image of the affine transformation is displayed at the given display coordinate. The result of (0, 0) means the top-left corner of the image. Note that this method may return a coordinate which lies outside the boundaries of the image.

        This is simply a convenience method which relies on the affinePointTransformer() method except that if the coordinate transformation is not yet available this method will return the same coordinates as specified in the argument.

        Parameters:
        displayPoint - the coordinates of the display to be converted to image coordinates. This argument cannot be null but the coordinates may lay outside the boundaries of the display. The coordinates (0, 0) specifies the top-left corner of this component.
        Returns:
        the coordinates of the pixel of the source image at the given display coordinate. This method never returns null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified coordinate is null
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - thrown if the transformation applied is not invertible

      • movePreAffinePointToDisplayPoint

        public final void movePreAffinePointToDisplayPoint(java.awt.geom.Point2D preAffinePoint,
                                    java.awt.geom.Point2D displayPoint)
        Sets the offset of the displayed image, so that the given pixel of the input image of the affine transformation will be displayed above the given coordinates of this component.

        If the coordinate transformation is not yet available (i.e., affinePointTransformer().getValue() returns null), this method is a no-op.

        Note that if this method ends up setting the offset of the displayed image, it will clear the zoom to fit mode (i.e.: calls clearZoomToFit()).

        Parameters:
        preAffinePoint - the coordinates of the input image of the affine transformation to be displayed at the specified position. This argument cannot be null. These coordinates may lay outside the boundaries of the image.
        displayPoint - the coordinates of this component where the specified pixel of the source image need to be displayed. These coordinates may lay outside the boundaries of this component.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if any of the arguments is null

      • getTransformations

        public final BasicImageTransformations getTransformations()
        Returns the snapshot of the currently set transformations. The return value does not include to currently set zoom to fit mode.
        Returns:
        the snapshot of the currently set transformations. This method never returns null.

      • setDefaultTransformations

        public final void setDefaultTransformations()
        Sets the applied transformations to the identity transformations. This method will also remove the zoom to fit mode if set.

      • setTransformations

        public final void setTransformations(BasicImageTransformations transformations)
        Sets all the transformation properties of this component from the specified BasicImageTransformations.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners. Note that this method does not necessarily invoke the listeners only after all properties have been set. That is, the effect of this method cannot be considered atomic in any way.

        This method always calls clearZoomToFit() prior to setting the transformations.

        Parameters:
        transformations - the BasicImageTransformations from which the properties are to be extracted. This argument cannot be null.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - thrown if the specified argument is null

      • setZoomY

        public final void setZoomY(double zoomY)
        Sets the scaling factor used to scale the image vertically. The scaling must be interpreted in the coordinate system of the original image. That is, zoomY adjusts the height of the original image.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        This method always calls clearZoomToFit() prior to setting the property.

        Parameters:
        zoomY - the scaling factor used to scale the image vertically
        See Also:
        TransformationListener.zoomChanged()

      • setZoomX

        public final void setZoomX(double zoomX)
        Sets the scaling factor used to scale the image horizontally. The scaling must be interpreted in the coordinate system of the original image. That is, zoomX adjusts the width of the original image.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        This method always calls clearZoomToFit() prior to setting the property.

        Parameters:
        zoomX - the scaling factor used to scale the image horizontally
        See Also:
        TransformationListener.zoomChanged()

      • setZoom

        public final void setZoom(double zoom)
        Sets the scaling factors used to scale the image horizontally and vertically to the same value. The scaling must be interpreted in the coordinate system of the original image. That is, zoom adjusts both the width and the height of the original image.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        This method always calls clearZoomToFit() prior to setting the property.

        Parameters:
        zoom - the scaling factor used to scale the image both horizontally and vertically
        See Also:
        TransformationListener.zoomChanged()

      • setRotateInRadians

        public final void setRotateInRadians(double radians)
        Sets the angle meaning how much the image need to be rotated around its center in radians. As the angle increases, the image need to be rotated clockwise. The zero angle means that the image is not rotated at all.

        Note: Settings this property also changes the value returned by the getTransformations().getRotateInDegrees() method.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        This method will clearZoomToFit() prior to setting the property, if and only, if alwaysClearZoomToFit has been set to true.

        Parameters:
        radians - the angle meaning how much the image need to be rotated around its center in radians. Note that this property is stored in a normalized form. So this property will be set to value between 0 and 2*pi or NaN.
        See Also:
        TransformationListener.rotateChanged()

      • setRotateInDegrees

        public final void setRotateInDegrees(int degrees)
        Sets the angle meaning how much the image need to be rotated around its center in degrees. As the angle increases, the image need to be rotated clockwise. The zero angle means that the image is not rotated at all.

        Notice that this property is an int, if you need better precision, use the setRotateInRadians method.

        Note: Settings this property also changes the value returned by the getTransformations().getRotateInRadians() method.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        This method will clearZoomToFit() prior to setting the property, if and only, if alwaysClearZoomToFit has been set to true.

        Parameters:
        degrees - the angle meaning how much the image need to be rotated around its center in degrees. Note that this property is stored in a normalized form. So this property will be set to value which is greater than or equal to zero and less than (not equal) to 360.
        See Also:
        TransformationListener.rotateChanged()

      • setOffset

        public final void setOffset(double offsetX,
             double offsetY)
        Sets both the horizontal an vertical offset need to be applied on the image.

        Note that these offsets are to be applied after zoom has been applied.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        This method always calls clearZoomToFit() prior to setting the property.

        Parameters:
        offsetX - the offset along the horizontal axis. Subsequent getTransformations().getOffsetX() method calls will return this value.
        offsetY - the offset along the vertical axis. Subsequent getTransformations().getOffsetY() method calls will return this value.
        See Also:
        TransformationListener.offsetChanged()

      • setFlipVertical

        public final void setFlipVertical(boolean flipVertical)
        Sets if the image should be flipped vertically. That is, if the top side of the image should become the bottom side of the image.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        This method will clearZoomToFit() prior to setting the property, if and only, if alwaysClearZoomToFit has been set to true.

        Parameters:
        flipVertical - if true the image should be flipped vertically, set it to false otherwise
        See Also:
        TransformationListener.flipChanged()

      • setFlipHorizontal

        public final void setFlipHorizontal(boolean flipHorizontal)
        Sets if the image should be flipped horizontally. That is, if the left side of the image should become the right side of the image.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        This method will clearZoomToFit() prior to setting the property, if and only, if alwaysClearZoomToFit has been set to true.

        Parameters:
        flipHorizontal - if true the image should be flipped horizontally, set it to false otherwise
        See Also:
        TransformationListener.flipChanged()

      • flipVertical

        public final void flipVertical()
        Inverts the "FlipVertical" property. Calling this method is effectively equivalent to calling: setFlipVertical(!getTransformations().isFlipVertical()).

        This method will notify the appropriate listeners.

        See Also:
        TransformationListener.flipChanged()

      • flipHorizontal

        public final void flipHorizontal()
        Inverts the "FlipHorizontal" property. Calling this method is effectively equivalent to calling: setFlipHorizontal(!getTransformations().isFlipHorizontal()).

        This method will notify the appropriate listeners.

        This method will clearZoomToFit() prior to setting the property, if and only, if the alwaysClearZoomToFit has been set to true.

        See Also:
        TransformationListener.flipChanged()

      • clearZoomToFit

        public final void clearZoomToFit()
        Removes this component from zoom to fit mode. That is, the image displayed is no longer required to fit the display.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        See Also:
        TransformationListener.leaveZoomToFitMode()

      • setZoomToFit

        public final void setZoomToFit(boolean keepAspectRatio,
                boolean magnify)
        Sets the zoom to fit mode with the following rules: ZoomToFitOption.FIT_HEIGHT, ZoomToFitOption.FIT_WIDTH and with the ones specified in the arguments.

        This method call is equivalent to calling: setZoomToFit(keepAspectRatio, magnify, true, true).

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        Parameters:
        keepAspectRatio - if true the zoom to fit mode will also include the rule: ZoomToFitOption.KEEP_ASPECT_RATIO
        magnify - if true the zoom to fit mode will also include the rule: ZoomToFitOption.MAY_MAGNIFY
        See Also:
        TransformationListener.enterZoomToFitMode(Set)

      • setZoomToFit

        public final void setZoomToFit(boolean keepAspectRatio,
                boolean magnify,
                boolean fitWidth,
                boolean fitHeight)
        Sets the zoom to fit mode with the specified rules.

        Subsequent getZoomToFitOptions() method calls will return these set of rules.

        If this method changes anything, it will invoke the appropriate listeners.

        Parameters:
        keepAspectRatio - if true the zoom to fit mode will include the rule: ZoomToFitOption.KEEP_ASPECT_RATIO
        magnify - if true the zoom to fit mode will include the rule: ZoomToFitOption.MAY_MAGNIFY
        fitWidth - if true the zoom to fit mode will include the rule: ZoomToFitOption.FIT_WIDTH
        fitHeight - if true the zoom to fit mode will include the rule: ZoomToFitOption.FIT_HEIGHT
